answers.answer: Hi there!Though Type 2 diabetes is less genetically predetermined, it is often found to run in families largely due to factors associated with lifestyle. To decrease the risk of diabetes it is important to maintain a healthy lifestyle with a healthy diet consisting of plenty of fruits and vegetables, indulge in regular physical activities, avoid stress, smoking, alcohol, excessive carbohydrates etc.Hope this information is helpful.Take care!

question: My family posses a long history of type two diabetes on both sides of my family, the only person in my family without is my mother. I worry that I may be pre-dispositoned to be more prone to type 2 diabetes because of this. What measures can I take to decrease that risk? What kinds of foods should i stay away from? Etc..?
title: At Risk?
